title: Riven is totally balanced.
body:
Mobility, Low cooldown Shield, Stun, Knockup, Execute and super high damage.

Can half health at level 1 just from Q (Not exaggerating). 

Completely and utterly balanced. Not even broken in the slightest.

replies.body: Yeah she is really unbalanced. I think to balance riven is to make her be a mana user that way she doesn't last in lane for ever.

Never understood why she is manaless, same with Katarina, there is no reason for them to be manaless they should use mana just like every other champion, that probably is the reason why they're always so broken, they have no restrictions on what they can do, just spam stupid spells over and over again, makes no sense.

Completely agree. 
I think champions should only be manaless when there is another mechanism replacing it, e.g. energy, rage etc.

A well-played Maokai hard counters her and is one of the few tanks in the game who can out-trade her early game. Her main trading combo guarantees Maokai a fully-stacked passive, Maokai's Q can cancel out her 3rd Q if timed correctly, Maokai gains innate damage reduction from Vengeful Maelstrom and the snare is not only point-and-click, but prevents her from using her Q or E, lasts a bit too if im not mistaken, 2 seconds at max rank i believe.

Also his E grants vision so he doesnt have to walk into an ambush from the brush.

She will only be balanced if she gets re-worked,
ATM she has 4 dashes, 1 stun, 1 knock up, 1 shield, 1 mega buff, a % execution ult (which is ranged and AoE) not to mention her passive which is better than most champs active abilities, her Q is 3 abilities in 1 (without their own separate cool downs like yasuo's Q), also adding insult to injury all her abilities scale off AD which funnily enough is the most useful stat in the game for melee bruisers anyway so she isn't going out of her build path at all, so to get damage and tanginess (shield) she only needs to build 1 stat.

She's pretty easy to beat to be honest. Used to have a lot of trouble against her until I learnt to counter her with Vlad, of all people. Just avoid her firs and second Q then harass her as she backs off. Once you learn to trade properly it's a fairly easy lane.

Recently found Volibear to be a decent counter to Riven (in lane). Q disrupts her combo, can flip her into tower range as most Rivens tower dive/harass. Combined with E her Q can stop her disengages. His W works well when trying to build tanky items as it also gives you damage. Ult for trading and clearing damage.
I can't completely confirm but E also causes your minions to divert attention to whoever champ that is attacking Volibear.

"causes your minions to divert attention to whoever champ that is attacking Volibear."
This is how Volibear beats me as Riven. Not anymore!

I should probably explain better in that, when you fear lane minions with E, if a champion is dealing damage to you, your own friendly minions will direct all of their attention to that champion, it doesn't last long but at early levels can deal substantial damage.

Riven was meant to be an arcade style Champion with no mana costs so as to be able to pay more attention to combos (Which she has quite a few of) and excels in facing up to 3 melee attackers at once (Initiator style Champion bent on many different situations - having to manage mana would reduce what is a commit based Champion who can excel and carry through (As a fighter) full brawls and not fade away during longer fights like many other Champions - yet in being manaless and combo based on cooldowns based - is a lot cooler than commit type tanks etc who simply do the same thing - without a skillset, through HP and auto-attacks, whilst not being as cool about as they are often out of mana mid-brawl.
